subject: Web3
title: Bitcoin as Legal Tender in El Salvador
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Bitcoin as Legal Tender in El Salvador.

hook.text: In 2021, El Salvador became the first country to make Bitcoin legal tender. Every business was required to accept it.

buildup.text: President Bukele launched the Chivo wallet, airdropped $30 in Bitcoin to every citizen, and bought Bitcoin with state funds.

discovery.text: The move aimed to reduce remittance costs and bank the 70% of Salvadorans without traditional bank accounts.

twist.text: Most citizens converted their $30 airdrop to cash immediately. Adoption remained low despite the mandate.

climax.text: The IMF pressured El Salvador to roll back the requirement. By 2024, accepting Bitcoin became voluntary.

punchline.text: A nation adopted Bitcoin by law. Its citizens preferred dollars by choice.

quiz.question: What happened with El Salvador's Bitcoin legal tender law?
options: Most citizens avoided it and the mandate was eventually rolled back
